post.title: Women don't want to be "just friends" with men.

body:
A friend of mine is really accomplished; went to a great school and has a great job. He has a lot of success ahead of him, as well as what he's experiencing now. He bought a really nice house just for himself with lots of toys- hot tub, motorcycles, musical instruments, full bar etc. Some women we know flirted with him heavily and he was nice to them but they wanted more and thankfully he knew he was better than them. He found an awesome, hot woman and have something serious going on but the other women are still hanging around. When he has a party they always show up and when he's not in the room they talk shit about him, including how easy white men have it. 

The friends in my life I would trust with my darkest secrets. They are awesome people I would do anything for. I don't see having that type of faith in any woman friends. It's just not part of their DNA.

body:
Not true, I've had tons of female friends over the years. Although I would fuck them if the opportunity presented itself and I was single, they were completely satisfied with just being my friend (maybe one or two exceptions where ex-girlfriends friend came on to me when we were alone).

Females are very selective and they generally all have a "type" that they like and want. Men are generally not as selective.

General advice I give to youngsters is : if you don't have romantic sparks right away, then don't become her "friend" thinking that you'll grow on her - because you won't, it's very rare. At first meeting you're either going to become her boyfriend or her friend.

body:
Young me fell into that trap with a few girls.  It's a lesson best learned by experience.

Had 2 women I was very close to that advised other women "Ewww...why would you date Epic_Lvl_Wizard"?

Those two women were basically dating me by proxy without sex.  IE I was a good friend to their boyfriends.  I knew both of them longer and than their current boyfriends and was basically their sounding board for dating advice.

body:
Women, (or more accurately, post modern feminist women,) *don't have friends*, period...

They are fundamentally disingenuous animals. The truth destroys them utterly. Therefore they NEED to expand their sphere of feminist fantasy by indoctrinating youth, or else they are at constant risk for being exposed as frauds.

Consider these facts.

Women don't express their genuine feelings: they are taught from infancy that displays of emotion are POWER OVER AUTHORITY. Mom and dad will do whatever you want if you cry hard enough. This dynamic (if indulged by weak parents/caretakers,) then corrupts their entire personality.

Women are almost always cosplaying as themselves. Makeup. Falsies. High heels. Wearing obfuscating garments to confound observers... They want to be taken seriously, but show up with 5 lbs of fake hair, like nobody can tell its a weave.

They are savagely hierarchical, (which is why they have a paranoid/delusional fixation on the "All Powerful Patriarchy" because they think men are also.) Their "friends" are either someone they hope can raise their status, or someone they can use. Anyone who is at the same approximate social strata is a rival, someone to compete against, so while they will fake friendship to maintain their charade, they are merely waiting for an opportunity to throw them under a bus without getting their hands dirty.

"Modern" women in general are frauds and not worth knowing as people. If you want to find a good woman look for one who refuses makeup and the clown trappings of the matriarchal order...

Edit: That's not completely fair... There are many women who know the real deal, but most of them are already taken and from an older generation. And younger women will often act and dress in a way to fit in more than to manipulate. The true point of division isn't cosmetics: its whether they advocate wokism. If their response to "are you a feminist," is "no, many women are trifling whores and they know it." You've found a keeper.

body:
In all honesty, Trump was a blessing on a social level to people in my age bracket.  Late 20's early 30's.

There are people who spend their lives benefiting from their 20's and people who spend their lives paying dearly for their 20's and their resentment dictates their actions until they accept accountability.  Trump Derangement syndrome made it extremely easy to identify the early warning signs between those 2 peer groups I mentioned above without necessitating any nuanced adult conversation.

5 years later and I'm pretty proud to say that my intuition holds true.  My former peers are fraying at the edges.  Foreclosures, divorces, massive health problems, repossessed cars, and general bitterness have made them too radioactive to be around.

parent.body:
In all honesty, Trump was a blessing on a social level to people in my age bracket.  Late 20's early 30's.

There are people who spend their lives benefiting from their 20's and people who spend their lives paying dearly for their 20's and their resentment dictates their actions until they accept accountability.  Trump Derangement syndrome made it extremely easy to identify the early warning signs between those 2 peer groups I mentioned above without necessitating any nuanced adult conversation.

5 years later and I'm pretty proud to say that my intuition holds true.  My former peers are fraying at the edges.  Foreclosures, divorces, massive health problems, repossessed cars, and general bitterness have made them too radioactive to be around.

body:
The women are wonderful effect isn't a theory, its a well documented phenomenon that begins in the uterus, where both male and female fetuses are attuned to the mother's biology.

It bypasses reason and logic by tapping into the endocrine system: you will literally become physically uncomfortable at a woman's disapproval due to hormonal responses to female keyed distress...

Its not a casual moral ideal, its a physiological imperative that makes sense in the wild, in animals, because male animals are much more likely to EAT offspring than females. But it makes gender equality without cultural understanding of the phenomenon impossible. 

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women-are-wonderful_effect

body: The problem is obsession with or paranoia about a) sex and b) feminism. Girls are always taught to think the other sex is stupid and not worth their time unless it's a bf, and to do everything the opposite of them. Boys too, are taught to be so ashamed of anything even remotely feminine that they can't even interact with the other sex comfortably anymore once they reach adulthood. The idea that they're inherently predatory and the only reason they'd talk to a girl is to get laid doesn't help their case either. So it ends up being assumed that the only reason the two would *ever* interact is for sexual purposes. Look at children and notice how they don't have this problem. Socialization plays a part too, girls are usually encouraged to live life and have fun, and boys are typically pressured to work and avoid vain activities, so by the time adulthood is reached they can barely relate to each other at all.

post.body:
Men are always blamed for ruining male-female platonic friendships. Supposedly, the male sex drive gets in the way and screws everything up. Women are clearly innocent, because they always keep a circle of guys that they claim are just friends.

Women are full of shit. Those guys in her circle aren't friends, they're backup mates. They're guys she doesn't find creepy, but isn't desperate enough to settle for. When her boyfriend is busy, or when she's single, they fulfill her need for male attention. They all secretly like her and she knows this, which is why she keeps them at arm's length -- if feelings are realised, she can't keep them as orbiters anymore.

Fellas, women don't want to be friends with you. They want to fuck you, or they want to fucking use you, or they want you to fuck off.

Ladies, if you keep a guy in the friendzone, you are setting the both of you up to fail. Either tell him to get lost or hook him up with one of your girlfriends, make him her problem.

body: Yeah, modern commercial culture tends to separate the father from the family, but having both parents at least provides a child the *opportunity* to understand the dynamic differences between how society treats men and women/children.

that's true, and it makes sense.

but unrelated to that, ive still seen way more people that have been raised by both parents than there are people raised by single mother, and the women are wonderfull effect can affect them regardless. it's just that being raised by single mothers happens to increase that.
